title: Prosecutor Who Sought to Use Evidence Derived From Torture Leaves Cole Case
description: The Biden administration had adopted a policy excluding all evidence obtained through torture; the prosecutor argued the law allowed it.

title: Zelensky Visits a City Just Miles From the Front, Underscoring Ukraine’s Gains
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s trip to a city reclaimed days ago demonstrated Ukraine’s growing boldness in the wake of Russia’s frantic retreat from the country’s northeast.

title: The State Department warned private citizens not to negotiate prisoner swaps with Russia.
Queen Elizabeth II Will Be Buried at Windsor Castle
description: The queen will be buried alongside her husband and royal predecessors in St. George’s Chapel.

title: In Russian Border City of Belgorod, the Ukraine War Feels Real
description: In Belgorod, 25 miles from Ukraine, recent losses by Russia’s military have brought home the reality of the war in a way not present elsewhere in the country.

title: President Biden will nominate Lynne M. Tracy, a career diplomat, to be ambassador to Russia.
Your Thursday Briefing: Pakistan, Submerged
description: Plus Volodymyr Zelensky visits a reclaimed city and the downfall of Malaysia’s former prime minister.

title: An Eastern City Under Attack Wonders How Far Ukraine’s Offensive Can Go
description: Bakhmut residents who have endured relentless shelling by the Russians watch the Ukrainian forces’ recent victories and weigh whether to stay or to flee.

title: Russia’s Retreat From the Northeast Is a Major Setback for Moscow
description: Ukraine’s success in the northeast raised the possibility that it would seek to reclaim territory in the eastern Donbas region, where Russia has supported separatist uprisings since 2014.

title: Sweden’s Far Right Just Made History. Is It the Country’s Future?
description: The anti-immigration Sweden Democrats beat out more moderate right-wing parties in a country famed for liberal governance. It is the latest example of the right’s staying power across Europe.

title: France Will Keep a Cap on Gas and Power Price Hikes in 2023
description: Élisabeth Borne, the prime minister, said the cap was far below the 120 percent hike that was expected without any government intervention as prices soar, exacerbated by the war in Ukraine.

title: Patagonia Founder Gives Away the Company to Fight Climate Change
description: Yvon Chouinard has forfeited ownership of the company he founded 49 years ago. The profits will now be used to fight climate change.

title: In Dramatic Shift, Right-Wing Bloc Wins Slim Majority in Sweden
description: Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson said on Wednesday that she would resign. Despite the success of the far-right Sweden Democrats, they will influence but are not expected to be formally part of the governing coalition.

title: Oil Executives Privately Contradicted Public Statements on Climate, Files Show
description: The documents, subpoenaed in a House investigation of climate disinformation, show company leaders contravening industry commitments.

title: Queen’s Coffin Passes Through London Landmarks to Westminster Hall
description: King Charles III, his siblings and his sons followed the gun carriage carrying the monarch to Westminster Hall, where she will lie in state.

title: Top E.U. Official Becomes an Unexpected Wartime Leader
description: In her annual address, Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, pushed for the bloc to remain firm in the face of Russian aggression.

title: E.U. Calls for Taxes and Handouts to Battle Rising Energy Prices
description: The European Commission wants the bloc’s members to impose taxes on the profits of energy companies to fund handouts to households and businesses.

title: Who Will Pay for Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral
description: The state will cover the huge price tag at a time when many in Britain are struggling to pay their bills and are bracing for a difficult winter.

title: Pakistan Suffers Record Flooding, Turning Villages Into Islands
description: The flooding has submerged vast areas, and residents still urgently await aid. Pakistani officials warn that it may take three to six months for the water to recede.

title: Top European Court Condemns France for Failing to Bring Home ISIS Families
description: Fighters’ families have been held in Kurdish-run camps in Syria for years. The court ruled that France had violated their right to return home by failing to repatriate them.

title: Ostracized by the West, Russia Finds a Partner in Saudi Arabia
description: The two oil-producing countries have extended their partnership even as the United States and Europe have sought to punish and isolate Russia for invading Ukraine.

title: Updates: Queen Elizabeth’s Coffin Leaves Buckingham Palace in a Solemn Procession
description: The queen’s coffin is being conveyed to Westminster Hall, where she will lie in state for four days. Watch our coverage live here.

title: Lawmakers Tell Biden Administration to Withhold Military Aid to Egypt
description: Senior Democratic lawmakers said the United States must not give aid to Egypt until it improves its human rights record, in the latest instance of tensions over Middle East policies.

title: Live Updates: Zelensky Visits Newly Reclaimed City as Ukraine’s Blitz Presses On
description: The Ukrainian president made an unannounced visit to Izium, which Kyiv’s forces seized in a lightning offensive in the northeast. Ukrainian officials said their next objective was to retake Lyman, a gateway to Russian-held Luhansk Province.

title: Why the Queen’s Coffin Will Leave Buckingham Palace at 2:22 p.m. Exactly
description: The procession will last 38 minutes and will “arrive at Westminster Hall at 3 p.m. on the dot.”

title: E.U.’s Top Official Details Plans For Lasting Support of Ukraine
description: Ursula von der Leyen’s State of the Union message asserted that the European Union would stick together against Russia despite the economic costs.

title: Europe Plans to Ban Goods Made With Forced Labor
description: While it does not explicitly mention Xinjiang, the western Chinese region where Uyghurs are believed to be pressed to work in camps, the proposal is widely seen as being aimed at Beijing.

title: Margrethe II of Denmark Is Now Reigning Queen in Europe
description: Though they ruled from capitals hundreds of miles apart, Queen Elizabeth and Queen Margrethe found time now and again to meet and spill the tea about family, children and other matters.

title: Poverty, Plunging
description: Child poverty in the U.S. has fallen by more than half since the early 1990s.

title: Where the New Climate Law Means More Drilling, Not Less
description: A compromise built into the law ensures oil and gas leasing in the Gulf of Mexico for the next decade. Activists say the region has been “sacrificed” to fossil fuels.

title: Xi Jinping Heads to Central Asia in First Foreign Trip Since 2020
description: Xi Jinping, who is expected to meet with Vladimir Putin, will seek to project confidence as a global statesman at a time of grave challenges at home.

title: Hermès Bags and Millions in Cash: The Fall of Malaysia’s Najib Razak
description: The former prime minister and his wife were once seen as untouchable. Now, both have been found guilty in connection with the 1MDB financial scandal.

title: Read Your Way Through Helsinki
description: Pajtim Statovci shares his love of Finnish literature and the books that helped him, a child of immigrants, to find his voice and grow from reader to award-winning writer.

title: Emergency Rooms Across Canada Close Amid Nursing Shortage
description: A nationwide shortage of nurses has caused dozens of emergency rooms across Canada to close temporarily and forced some patients to wait days for a bed.

title: An Oily Challenge: Evict Stinky Old Furnaces in Favor of Heat Pumps
description: Building by building, New York and other cities are trying to stop the age-old use of fossil fuels to heat homes and buildings. In the U.S., new climate laws aim to speed things up.

title: How Time Softened Judgment of Camilla and Fury Over Diana’s Death
description: A quarter-century ago Princess Diana’s shocking death provoked outrage at the royal family. Queen Elizabeth’s passing, in contrast, has been draped in civility and respect.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Falling Russian morale.
